topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack 2.0: Adding Proxy, Account, Container (PAC) Node

body.p: This page describes the procedure to add new node(s)/Swift Proxy, Account, Container (PAC) server to an existing system.

section.title: Procedure to add a new node
section.p: To add a new node to your cloud, you will need to add it to servers.yml, and then run the scripts that update your cloud configuration. To begin, access the servers.yml file by checking out the git branch where you are required to make the changes:

Perform the following steps to add a new node:
Get the server.yml file stored in git:cd ~/helion/my_cloud/definition/data git checkout site
If not already done, set the weight-step attribute. See Setting the weight-step attribute .
Add details of new node(s) to servers.yml file as follows.servers: ... - id: swpac4 role: SWPAC-ROLE server-group: <server-group-name> mac-addr: <mac-address> nic-mapping: <nic-mapping-name> ip-addr: <ip-address> ilo-ip: <ilo-ip-address> ilo-user: <ilo-username> ilo-password: <ilo-password>
In the above example only one new server swpac6 is added. However, you can add multiple servers by providing the server details in the servers.yml file.
In the entry-scale configurations, there is no dedicated Swift PAC cluster. Instead there is a cluster using servers of role CONTROLLER-ROLE. You cannot add swpac4 to this cluster because that would change the member count. If your system does not already have a dedicated Swift PAC cluster, you need to add it to the input model as explained in HPE Helion OpenStack 2.0: Creating a Proxy, Account, Container (PAC) Cluster. The following steps assume that you have already created a dedicated Swift PAC cluster and as per this example it has two members (swpac4 and swpac5).
Increase the member count of the Swift PAC cluster as appropriate. For example, if you are adding swpac6 and you previously had 2 Swift PAC nodes, the increased member count should be 3 as shown in the following sample.
control-planes: - name: control-plane-1 control-plane-prefix: cp1
. . . clusters: . . . - name: <cluster name> cluster-prefix: c2 server-role: SWPAC-ROLE member-count: 3 . . .
Commit your changes.git add -A git commit -m "Add Node <name>"
Run the configuration processor:cd ~/helion/hos/ansible ansible-playbook -i hosts/localhost config-processor-run.yml
Run the following command to create a deployment directory.cd ~/helion/hos/ansible ansible-playbook -i hosts/localhost ready-deployment.yml
Configure cobbler to include the new node and reimage the node as follows. If you are adding several nodes, use a comma separated list the nodelist argument:ansible-playbook -i hosts/localhost cobbler-deploy.yml ansible-playbook -i hosts/localhost bm-reimage.yml -e nodelist=<extra_vars>
In the following example we have used server id as swpac6 (mentioned in step 3).ansible-playbook -i hosts/localhost cobbler-deploy.yml ansible-playbook -i hosts/localhost bm-reimage.yml -e nodelist=swpac6You must use the server id as it appears in the servers.yml file in the field <extra_vars>
Examine the cloudConfig.yml and data/control_plane.yml files to get the host prefix (for example, helion) and the control plane name (for example, cp1). This gives you the hostname of the node. Configure the operating system as follows.cd ~/scratch/ansible/next/hos/ansible ansible-playbook -i hosts/verb_hosts osconfig-run.yml –limit <hostname>
For example, for swpac6, the hostname is helion-cp1-c2-m3-mgmt. cd ~/scratch/ansible/next/hos/ansible ansible-playbook -i hosts/verb_hosts osconfig-run.yml –limit helion-cp1-c2-m3-mgmt
Validate that the disk drives of the new node are compatible with the disk model used by the node as follows.cd ~/scratch/ansible/next/hos/ansible ansible-playbook -i hosts/verb_hosts _swift-validate-input-model.ymlIf any errors occur, review Interpreting _swift-validate-input-model.yml Errors.
Run the hlm-deploy.yml playbook to rebalance the rings to include the node, deploy the rings and to configure the new node. Do not limit to just the node (swpac6) that you are adding.cd ~/scratch/ansible/next/hos/ansible ansible-playbook -i hosts/verb_hosts hlm-deploy.yml
Further rebalances of the rings may be necessary. Use the process described in weight change phase of ring rebalance and final Rebalance phase at .
Run the following command:ansible-playbook -i hosts/verb_hosts hlm-deploy.yml --limit SWF*
